poem:
### Accredited Shadows

From the high towers,   
voices shout of care,  
while below,   
the janitor navigates  
a sea of dust and whispers,  
his hands calloused, unseen.  
Coins fall like autumn leaves,  
but do not fill pockets.  
Accreditation, a badge of air,  
worn by those  
who turn a blind eye  
to the invisible weight.
